#Text=Fold a Napkin
#Text=Add a little flair to any dinner with elegant napkin folds .
#Text=Folding napkins is a time-honored tradition used in restaurants and homes alike .
#Text=It 's simple , classy , and easy to master .
#Text=Read on for several different instructions on how to fold a napkin .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Goblet Fan
#Text=Fold the napkin in half to form a long rectangle .
#Text=Starting at one short end , fold the napkin like an accordion all the way to the opposite end .
#Text=Holding one folded end , place it into your drinking glass .
#Text=Let the napkin fan over the top of the glass .
#Text=Pyramid
#Text=Lay the napkin out in front of you .
#Text=If your napkin flops down easily , ironing it with a little bit of light starch should help this process .
#Text=Fold the napkin across diagonally .
#Text=Turn the folded napkin so that the tip of the napkin is facing directly in front of you .
#Text=Fold the right corner down to meet the tip of the napkin .
#Text=Make sure that this fold creates a clean center line in the middle of the napkin .
#Text=Fold the left corner down to meet the tip of the napkin , mirroring the last step .
#Text=The napkin should now look like a diamond .
#Text=Turn the napkin over , keeping the open end of the napkin away from you .
#Text=Fold the farthest point of the diamond back over itself , creating a triangle .
#Text=The tip of the triangle should be pointing down .
#Text=Fold the napkin along the center seam , right to left .
#Text=Prop it up like a tent .
#Text=If your napkin is floppy and wo n't stay propped up , you may need a little starch .
#Text=Bishop 's Hat
#Text=Lay the napkin out in front of you .
#Text=If your napkin flops down easily , ironing it with a little bit of light starch should help this process .
#Text=Fold the napkin in half by bringing the top end down .
#Text=You should have a rectangle now .
#Text=Bring the top right corner down to the middle-bottom of the napkin .
#Text=Bring the bottom left corner up to the middle-top of the napkin .
#Text=You should have a parallelogram now .
#Text=Flip the napkin over and rearrange it so that the top left and bottom right edges are sticking out .
#Text=Fold the bottom of the napkin up and towards the top half .
#Text=The edges should all be meeting each other , except for a stray triangle at the bottom left of the napkin .
#Text=Gently bring out the flap on the right so that it forms another triangle on the bottom right .
#Text=Bring the top left corner and tuck it underneath the triangle on the right .
#Text=The left triangle is now folded in half .
#Text=Flip the triangle over so that the two points are now facing up .
#Text=Fold the right edge into the left flap .
#Text=The napkin should be completely symmetrical again .
#Text=Push the folds in the center of the hat down so that the base of the bishop 's hat is circular .
#Text=Finished .
#Text=Basic Silverware
#Text=Pouch
#Text=Lay the napkin out in front of you .
#Text=Fold the napkin in half by bringing the top end down .
#Text=You should have a rectangle now .
#Text=Fold the napkin again to create a square .
#Text=Move the right end over the left end .
#Text=Turn the napkin around so that the open corner is facing top-left .
#Text=Bring the top fold of the top-left corner of the napkin down diagonally to the bottom-right .
#Text=Flip the triangle over so that the open corner is now facing top-right .
#Text=Fold the right side over about 1/3 of the way and crease the fold .
#Text=Fold the left side over about 1/3 of the way and fit it into the little fold created at the bottom right .
#Text=Flip the napkin over again and arrange any utensils inside the napkin .
#Text=Finished .
#Text=Quick Summary
